Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Agility \A*gil"i*ty\, n. [F. agili['e], L. agilitas, fr. agilis.] 1. The quality of being agile; the power of moving the limbs quickly and easily; nimbleness; activity; quickness of motion; as, strength and agility of body. [1913 Webster]
They . . . trust to the agility of their wit. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
Wheeling with the agility of a hawk. --Sir W. Scott. [1913 Webster]
2. Activity; powerful agency. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The agility of the sun's fiery heat. --Holland. [1913 Webster]
agility n : the gracefulness of a person or animal that is quick and nimble [syn: {legerity}, {lightness}, {lightsomeness}, {nimbleness}]
